summary: Fancy remodel of Proudspire Manor, house for a thane of Haafingar in Solitude. Tiny house with decoration, bookshelves, and wine.
descriptionHtml:
[font=Verdana][size=2]Requirements: DLCs and [/size][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/71214/]USLEEP[/url][size=2].[/size]

[size=1][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/71214/]Unofficial patch[/url] dependency is here to stay because of changes to quests and location data.[/size]

[size=2]I was a bit unhappy about all the differences between Proudspire's exterior and interior, so I decided to remodel the interior to make it closer to the exterior. It is nowhere near 100% match or anything like that, but it's a little bit closer than in vanilla, I think.[/size]
[size=2]
This is a completely different house with two floors and an attic. Kitchen and living room on the first floor, bedroom and lounge area with a couch on second, mostly garbage on third. See screenshots for details.

This is for Oldrim, but you now can find [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/15162/]Special Edition conversion here[/url].[/size]


[i]Is this mod lore friendly?

[/i][size=2]Nah, probably not really :p[/size][/font]

[center][font=Verdana][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/headers/88918.jpg[/img][/font][/center][font=Verdana]
[size=2][i]Is there a place for family? Kids?[/i]

Nope. Not even for a spouse. It is more of an expensive man cave for a person of any gender. Lone soldier going on [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/70495/]Amorous Adventures[/url] perhaps... By the way, there is a (subtle?) NSFW hint in the house (bedroom), so keep that in mind.[/size][/font]

[font=Verdana][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/88918/88918-1516040130-515652916.jpeg[/img][/font]

[font=Verdana][size=2]Of course, Jordis is here, but with mods like [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/62040/]My Home Is Your Home[/url] you can find her a different place to stay (otherwise she will sandbox around the house and sleep on the couch).

If you want your kids to live in Solitude, check out [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/88459]Deithwen - Family Edition[/url].[/size][/font]

[font=Verdana][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/88918/88918-1515942055-163589993.jpeg[/img][/font]

[font=Verdana][i]Functionality:[/i]

[size=2]8 bookshelves for 11 books each (more if you use [/size][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/10891]Unlimited Bookshelves[/url][size=2], check out [/size][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/88918?tab=images]'Images' tab[/url][size=2] to see how many books could fit in). Cooking pot, oven, alchemy lab – no animation, but all working. A lot of custom containers, two single beds (master bed and sofa[/size][size=1]*[/size][size=2] on the second floor), one weapon plaque for two weapons and a shield.[/size]
[size=1]
[/size][size=1]*Sofa is set to "Child can use", so if you have a kid follower, they should be able to sleep there too. Hypothetically. Make sure you have something to prevent scaling, like [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/41304/]SIZE DOES MATTER[/url]. Again, no adoption, I'm only talking about followers here.[/size]

[size=2]It is an apartment in a big city, so other crafting stations could be found elsewhere, especially with city mods. If you need more displays, I highly recommend [/size][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/52248/]Legacy of the Dragonborn[/url][size=2], the museum is in Solitude as well.[/size][/font]

[font=Verdana][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/88918/88918-1515920496-1442236542.jpeg[/img][/font]
[font=Verdana]
[i]Compatibility:[/i]

[size=2]Probably incompatible with anything editing Proudspire Manor, lighting mods for example might cause small issues[/size][size=1]**[/size][size=2]. Should be good with city mods, because I only changed the patio on the outside, and city mods usually don't edit that area. If you came across some compatibility issues, let me know, I'll include it here.[/size]

[size=2]**[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/27043/]ELFX[/url]: install ELFX - NoProudspireManor.esp or just remove ELFX's edits to this cell in TES5Edit.

Regarding any other mod editing SolitudeProudspireManor cell, furniture or light – same thing applies.

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/61035]JK's[/url] seems alright.

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/9557]Alternate Start - Live Another Life[/url] is semi-compatible: use the optional patch on this page to move the starting spawning spot in the Proudspire Manor (no need for that patch if you start the game elsewhere).

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/8058/]Open Cities[/url] is not compatible (door markers, again, and the patio, naturally).

[/size][/font][font=Verdana][size=2]Starting with 1.1 semi-compatible with [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/74638/]Holds The City Overhaul[/url] (no crashes, but door markers aren't in the right places, use optional patch on this page to move them if you want).[/size][/font]

[font=Verdana][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/88918/88918-1516039228-1088028963.jpeg[/img][/font]

[font=Verdana][size=2]I recommend to [/size][b][color=#e82a1f][b]only install[/b][/color][/b] [size=2]this [/size][b][color=#e82a1f][b]on a new game[/b][/color][/b][size=2] (aka start a new game with this mod already enabled), not to add to an existing save. Otherwise some things will be broken, even if you didn't visited the manor before. You can always experiment at your own expense of course, but racks won't work, a quest item will float in space etc. If you start a new game these issues should be avoided.[/size]

[size=2]And yes, no house decoration purchases are needed, you only have to buy the house itself.[/size][/font]

[font=Verdana][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/88918/88918-1516039791-305492061.jpeg[/img][/font]
[size=2]
[font=Verdana][i]Credits:

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/45540]Strotis Craftsman Tools[/url]
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/42690]Strotis Kitchen Tools[/url]
[/font][/size][font=Verdana][size=2][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/36386]Strotis Manor Resource[/url]
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/37176]Strotis Old Mill Resource[/url]
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/34969]Strotis Ovens Resource[/url]
[url=https://www.darkcreations.org/files/file/1227-table-top-planters/]Table top Planters[/url]
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/77097]The Witcher 3 Mega Resource Pack[/url]
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/68040]Tlaffoon's Rugs and Tapestries[/url]
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/82459/]Upper Class Furniture Pack V2.0[/url]
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/63255]Upper Class Furniture Pack[/url]
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/40676]Windows Resource Pack[/url]

Thanks to [url=https://www.creationkit.com/index.php?title=Light_Switch]this light switch script[/url] the light is dynamic: more warm during the night, more cold during the day. Most candles are off during daytime. I recommend using mods like [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/6971]Visible Windows[/url] or [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/54302]Rustic Windows[/url] to make windows themselves look differently depending on time of day.[/size][/font]

[font=Verdana][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/88918/88918-1516039484-449891435.jpeg[/img][/font]

[font=Verdana][size=2]Do submit pics with all the graphic enhancements, texture replacements, ENBs etc. Screenshots I uploaded made with [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/41482/]Rudy ENB[/url], some with [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/27043/]ELFX[/url] as well.

Architecture pieces are vanilla (or based on vanilla), so how the house looks will depend on your (re)textures.[/size][/font]

[center][font=Verdana][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/thumbnails/65163-1-1430165136.png[/img]﻿[/font][/center]
[size=2]
[font=Verdana]This mod is Nexus only and not for sale, do not reupload it anywhere.

[/font][/size][font=Verdana][size=2]If you want to [s]port it to SE or[/s] do something [s]else[/s] to it, just let me know at some point, give links, credits to modder resources' authors as well and all that, thanks.[/size][/font]

[font=Verdana][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/88918/88918-1516045590-841340744.jpeg[/img][/font][size=2]

author: boringvlln

files.name: Update 1.2
files.changelogHtml:
Big deal fix, cause apparently some changes were really not at all necessary and interfered with other houses (really sorry for that).

> restored water height
> removed ownership
> removed changes to house purchase quests

Based on SE testing.
